derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 17th cent. (earlier as hieratical): via Latin from Greek hieratikos, from hierasthai 'be a priest', from hiereus 'priest', hieros 'sacred'

means.word_mean: 1. a cursive form of Egyptian hieroglyphics; used especially by the priests
1. associated with the priesthood or priests;
2. written or belonging to a cursive form of ancient Egyptian writing;
3. adhering to fixed types or methods; highly restrained and formal;
